page.title: 08Transport,Brickhill,Bedford
page.content: The estate is served by the United Counties 'Bus Company which has two services (106 & 107) which lead to the town centre and beyond. The services run alternatively at 15 minute intervals but the cost of frequent travel by families is such that most families have their own means of transport. In the school survey, 92% of the families owned at least one motor-car. 10% of the families also owned a caravan. 3% owned a boat. Nearly every child old enough to ride a bicycle had one. Many of the children had the latest models with many gears or else had a BMX type of sports model. Road safety measures in the form of crossing patrols, cycling proficiency courses and other school projects are much in evidence in Bedford.
